test_name: Verify Pagination Functionality in Women Category
description: Test the functionality of navigating through multiple pages of product listings in the Women category.
steps: Navigate to the Women category page.
Locate the pagination links at the bottom of the page.
Wait for the page to refresh with the next set of product listings.
Verify that the products on page 2 are displayed.
Click on the 'Next' link to navigate to the next page.
Verify the correct navigation to the next set of product listings.
expected_results: Correct set of products is displayed for the selected page.
Pagination links are functional and responsive.
No duplicate products are shown across pages.
edge_cases: Wrong set of products is displayed for a selected page.
Products do not load for subsequent pages.
Pagination links are missing or disabled.
data_requirements: A list of products distributed across multiple pages in the Women category.
Correct mapping of products to their respective pages.
No missing product data for any page.
Frontend and backend communication for pagination functionality.
dependencies: Products must load properly on the page.
Backend endpoint for pagination must be available.
Correct page data for all products.
JavaScript functionality for pagination link interaction.
api_interactions: Verify API endpoint for fetching paginated product data.
Ensure pagination criteria are passed to the backend API.
performance_metrics: Pagination operation should complete within 2 seconds.
Page should not experience lag during pagination.
Pagination link interaction should be seamless.
accessibility_requirements: Pagination links must be accessible via keyboard navigation.
Pagination labels must have clear descriptions for screen readers.
Ensure no visual elements overlap or block the pagination links.
